meanings.definition: The act of organizing a business or industry as a corporation.
meanings.sent1: The corporatization of the small family-owned bakery led to increased efficiency and profits.
meanings.sent2: Many companies undergo corporatization to attract more investors and expand their operations.
meanings.sent3: The corporatization of the lemonade stand turned it into a serious business venture.
meanings.sent4: In the world of superheroes, the corporatization of crime-fighting led to a rise in corporate-sponsored heroes.
meanings.sent5: The corporatization of the music industry changed the way artists interacted with their fans.

meanings.definition: The process of transforming a government organization or service into a corporation.
meanings.sent1: The corporatization of the postal service aimed to improve its efficiency and customer service.
meanings.sent2: Government corporatization often involves restructuring and privatizing certain services.
meanings.sent3: The corporatization of the public library system raised eyebrows among book lovers.
meanings.sent4: In a futuristic society, the corporatization of public transportation made commuting more convenient but expensive.
meanings.sent5: The corporatization of healthcare services changed the way patients accessed medical care.
